intro: Bomarea edulis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered edible bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are often used in local traditional medicine. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers with prominent, showy petals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
